IEvaluation

enspire.interactivity.evaluation.IEvaluation
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.SimpleChoiceEvaluation
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.SimpleDDEvaluation
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.SimpleEvaluation
enspire.interactivity.evaluation.SimpleMultSliderEvaluation
2 other children

Evaluations are bundles of data representing the current state of an activity.  More specifically, these are bundles generated whenever the user’s answer or completion of an activity is being assessed.  In practical terms, evaluations are generated whenever the ‘submit’ button is pressed.

All evaluations should implement the following interface.  At the most basic, they should all encapsulate the correctness of the user’s answer, and the current number of tries/attempts by the user.

Summary
IEvaluationEvaluations are bundles of data representing the current state of an activity.
Functions
getCorrectReturns true if the user’s most recent attempt at the interactivity was correct, false otherwise.
getNumTriesReturns the number of times that the user has attempted the current interactivity.

Functions

getCorrect

function getCorrect():Boolean

Returns true if the user’s most recent attempt at the interactivity was correct, false otherwise.

getNumTries

function getNumTries():Number

Returns the number of times that the user has attempted the current interactivity.  The first evaluation generated by the activity will return 1 when getNumTries() is called on it.

Event that is dispatched from any Movie Clip that inherits from HotSpot when the standard mouse actions are performed on the clip.
Event that is dispatched from any Movie Clip that inherits from HotSpot when the standard mouse actions are performed on the clip.
This is the most basic implementation of IEvaluation.
